member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate
member.summary: Allowed updates

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.Message
member.summary: Message update: New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.EditedMessage
member.summary: Edited message update: New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.ChannelPost
member.summary: Channel post update: New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.EditedChannelPost
member.summary: Edited channel post update: New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.InlineQuery
member.summary: Inline query update. New incoming inline query.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.ChosenInlineResult
member.summary: Chosen inline result update: The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.CallbackQuery
member.summary: Callback query update: New incoming callback query.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.ShippingQuery
member.summary: Shipping query update: New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.PreCheckoutQuery
member.summary: Pre checkout query update: New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.Poll
member.summary: Poll update: New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.PollAnswer
member.summary: Poll answer update: A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.MyChatMember
member.summary: My chat member update: The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.ChatMember
member.summary: Chat member update: A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

member.name: F:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.AllowedUpdate.ChatJoinRequest
member.summary: Chat join request: A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.GetUpdatesArgs
member.summary: GetUpdate method arguments

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.GetUpdatesArgs.Offset
member.summary: Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.GetUpdatesArgs.Limit
member.summary: Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.GetUpdatesArgs.Timeout
member.summary: Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.GetUpdatesArgs.AllowedUpdates
member.summary:
List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs
member.summary: SetWebhook method arguments

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.Url
member.summary: HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.Certificate
member.summary: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.IpAddress
member.summary: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.MaxConnections
member.summary: Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot‘s server, and higher values to increase your bot’s throughput.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.AllowedUpdates
member.summary:
List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.SetWebhookArgs.DropPendingUpdates
member.summary: Pass True to drop all pending updates.

Identifier of the first update to be returned. Must be greater by one than the highest among the identifiers of previously received updates. By default, updates starting with the earliest unconfirmed update are returned.
Limits the number of updates to be retrieved. Values between 1—100 are accepted. Defaults to 100.
Timeout in seconds for long polling. Defaults to 0, i.e. usual short polling. Should be positive, short polling should be used for testing purposes only.

List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the getUpdates, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.

member.summary: Use this method to specify a url and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified url, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success.
member.param: BotClient
HTTPS url to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration.
Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.
The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS

Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot‘s server, and higher values to increase your bot’s throughput.

List the types of updates you want your bot to receive. For example, specify [“message”, “edited_channel_post”, “callback_query”] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all updates regardless of type (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used.
Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.
Pass True to drop all pending updates.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update
member.summary: This object represents an incoming update. At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.UpdateId
member.summary: The update‘s unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially handy if you’re using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.Message
member.summary: Optional. New incoming message of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.EditedMessage
member.summary: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.ChannelPost
member.summary: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind — text, photo, sticker, etc.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.EditedChannelPost
member.summary: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.InlineQuery
member.summary: Optional. New incoming inline query.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.ChosenInlineResult
member.summary: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.CallbackQuery
member.summary: Optional. New incoming callback query.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.ShippingQuery
member.summary: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.PreCheckoutQuery
member.summary: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.Poll
member.summary: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.PollAnswer
member.summary: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.MyChatMember
member.summary: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.ChatMember
member.summary: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify “chat_member” in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.ChatJoinRequest
member.summary: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.Update.Type
member.summary: Update type.

member.summary: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.HasCustomCertificate
member.summary: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.PendingUpdateCount
member.summary: Number of updates awaiting delivery.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.IpAddress
member.summary: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.LastErrorDate
member.summary: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.LastErrorMessage
member.summary: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook.

member.summary: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters.

member.summary: Optional. Maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.GettingUpdates.WebhookInfo.AllowedUpdates

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InlineModeExtensions.AnswerInlineQuery(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InlineQueryResult},System.Nullable{System.UInt32},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query. On success, True is returned.
No more than 50 results per query are allowed.
member.param: The bot client.
Unique identifier for the answered query.
A JSON-serialized array of results for the inline query.
The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.
Pass True, if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query.

Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.
If passed, clients will display a button with specified text that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with the parameter switch_pm_parameter.

Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when user presses the switch button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.
Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly.To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any.The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link.Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.summary: Product description, 1-255 characters.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.Payload
member.summary: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.ProviderToken
member.summary: Payment provider token, obtained via Botfather.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.Currency
member.summary: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.Prices
member.summary: Price breakdown, a list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.).

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.MaxTipAmount
member.summary: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.SuggestedTipAmounts
member.summary: Optional. An array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.ProviderData
member.summary: Optional. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.PhotoUrl
member.summary: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.PhotoSize
member.summary: Optional. Photo size.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.PhotoWidth
member.summary: Optional. Photo width.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.PhotoHeight
member.summary: Optional. Photo height.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.NeedName
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.NeedPhoneNumber
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order.

member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.NeedShippingAddress
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.SendPhoneNumberToProvider

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.InlineMode.InputInvoiceMessageContent.SendEmailToProvider
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider.

member.summary: Payments

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.PaymentsExtensions.AnswerPreCheckoutQuery(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Bot API sends the final confirmation in the form of an Update with the field pre_checkout_query. Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries. On success, True is returned. Note: The Bot API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.
member.param: Bot Client
Unique identifier for the query to be answered.
Specify True if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order. Use False if there are any problems.

Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.summary: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Bot API will send an Update with a shipping_query field to the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries. On success, True is returned.
member.param: The bot client.
Unique identifier for the query to be answered.
Specify True if delivery to the specified address is possible and False if there are any problems (for example, if delivery to the specified address is not possible).
Required if ok is True. A JSON-serialized array of available shipping options.

Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

member.summary: Use this method to send invoices. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: The bot client.
Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername).
Product name, 1-32 characters.
Product description, 1-255 characters.
Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.
Payments provider token, obtained via Botfather.
Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies.
Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.).

The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0.

A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter.
A JSON-serialized data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.
URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.
Photo size.
Photo width.
Photo height.
Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order.
Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order.
Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order.
Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order.
Pass True, if user's phone number should be sent to provider.
Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider.
Pass True, if the final price depends on the shipping method.
Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving.
If the message is a reply, ID of the original message.
Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found.
A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.summary: Required if ok is False. Error message in human readable form that explains why it is impossible to complete the order (e.g. "Sorry, delivery to your desired address is unavailable'). Telegram will display this message to the user.

member.summary: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.Prices
member.summary: Price breakdown, a list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.)

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.MaxTipAmount
member.summary: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.SuggestedTipAmounts
member.summary: Optional. An array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.StartParameter
member.summary: Optional. Unique deep-linking parameter. If left empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice. If non-empty, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.ProviderData
member.summary: Optional. JSON-encoded data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.PhotoUrl
member.summary: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.PhotoSize
member.summary: Optional. Photo size.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.PhotoWidth
member.summary: Optional. Photo width.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.PhotoHeight
member.summary: Optional. Photo height.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.NeedName
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's full name to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.NeedPhoneNumber
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's phone number to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.NeedEmail
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's email address to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.NeedShippingAddress
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.SendPhoneNumberToProvider
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if user's phone number should be sent to provider.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.SendEmailToProvider
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if user's email address should be sent to provider.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.IsFlexible
member.summary: Optional. Pass True, if the final price depends on the shipping method.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Payments.SendInvoiceArgs.ReplyMarkup
member.summary: Optional. A object for an inline keyboard. If empty, one 'Pay total price' button will be shown. If not empty, the first button must be a Pay button.

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.StickersExtensions.AddStickerToSet(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,Telegram.BotAPI.AvailableTypes.InputFile,Telegram.BotAPI.AvailableTypes.InputFile,Telegram.BotAPI.AvailableTypes.InputFile,Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition)
member.summary: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker, tgs_sticker, or webm_sticker. Animated stickers can be added to animated sticker sets and only to them. Animated sticker sets can have up to 50 stickers. Static sticker sets can have up to 120 stickers. Returns True on success.
member.param: The bot client.
User identifier of sticker set owner.
Sticker set name.
One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker.

PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files ».
TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements for technical requirements.
WEBM video with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements for technical requirements.
A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.summary: Use this method to create a new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to edit the sticker set thus created. You must use exactly one of the fields png_sticker, tgs_sticker, or webm_sticker. Returns True on success.
member.param: The bot client.
User identifier of created sticker set owner.

Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.
Sticker set title, 1-64 characters.
One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker.

PNG image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files ».
TGS animation with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements for technical requirements.
WEBM video with the sticker, uploaded using multipart/form-data. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements for technical requirements.
Pass True, if a set of mask stickers should be created.
A JSON-serialized object for position where the mask should be placed on faces.

member.summary: Use this method to send static .WEBP or animated .TGS stickers. On success, the sent Message is returned.
member.param: The bot client.
Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername).

Sticker to send. Pass a file_id as String to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a .WEBP file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files ».
Sends the message silently. Users will receive a notification with no sound.
Protects the contents of the sent message from forwarding and saving.
If the message is a reply, ID of the original message.
Pass True, if the message should be sent even if the specified replied-to message is not found.
Additional interface options. A JSON-serialized object for an inline keyboard, custom reply keyboard, instructions to remove reply keyboard or to force a reply from the user.

Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.StickersExtensions.SetStickerSetThumb(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,System.String,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a sticker set. Animated thumbnails can be set for animated sticker sets only. Returns True on success.
member.param: BotClient
Sticker set name
User identifier of the sticker set owner

A PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have width and height exactly 100px, or a TGS animation with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/animated_stickers#technical-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More info on Sending Files ». Animated sticker set thumbnail can't be uploaded via HTTP URL.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.summary: Initialize a new instance of .
member.param: User identifier of created sticker set owner.

Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.
Sticker set title, 1-64 characters.
One or more emoji corresponding to the sticker.

member.summary: Short name of sticker set, to be used in t.me/addstickers/ URLs (e.g., animals). Can contain only english letters, digits and underscores. Must begin with a letter, can't contain consecutive underscores and must end in “_by_<bot username>”. <bot_username> is case insensitive. 1-64 characters.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.UploadStickerFileArgs.UserId
member.summary: User identifier of sticker file owner.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.UploadStickerFileArgs.PngSticker
member.summary: Png image with the sticker, must be up to 512 kilobytes in size, dimensions must not exceed 512px, and either width or height must be exactly 512px.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition
member.summary: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition.Point
member.summary: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition.XShift
member.summary: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition.YShift
member.summary: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.Stickers.MaskPosition.Scale
member.summary: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedCredentials
member.summary: Contains data required for decrypting and authenticating EncryptedPassportElement. See the Telegram Passport Documentation for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedCredentials.Data
member.summary: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for EncryptedPassportElement decryption and authentication.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedCredentials.Hash
member.summary: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedCredentials.Secret
member.summary: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement
member.summary: Contains information about documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Type
member.summary: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Data
member.summary: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user, available for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.PhoneNumber
member.summary: Optional. User's verified phone number, available only for “phone_number” type.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Email
member.summary: Optional. User's verified email address, available only for “email” type.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Files
member.summary: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user, available for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.FrontSide
member.summary: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.ReverseSide
member.summary: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user. Available for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Selfie
member.summary: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Translation
member.summary: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user. Available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.EncryptedPassportElement.Hash
member.summary: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.PassportData
member.summary: Contains information about Telegram Passport data shared with the bot by the user.

member.summary: Array with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that was shared with the bot.

member.name: P:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.PassportData.Credentials
member.summary: Encrypted credentials required to decrypt the data.

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.TelegramPassportExtensions.SetPassportDataErrors(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,Telegram.BotAPI.TelegramPassport.SetPassportDataErrorsArgs)
member.summary:
Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success.
Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.
member.param: Bot Client
Parameters.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.name: T:Telegram.BotAPI.UpdatingMessages.UpdatingMessagesExtensions
member.summary: Updating messages

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.UpdatingMessages.UpdatingMessagesExtensions.DeleteMessage(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Use this method to delete a message, including service messages, with the following limitations:
- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.
- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.
- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.
- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.
- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has can_delete_messages permission in a supergroup or a channel, it can delete any message there.
Returns True on success.
member.param: BotClient
Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername).
Identifier of the message to delete.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.

member.name: M:Telegram.BotAPI.UpdatingMessages.UpdatingMessagesExtensions.EditMessageMedia(Telegram.BotAPI.BotClient,Telegram.BotAPI.UpdatingMessages.EditMessageMediaArgs)
member.summary: Use this method to edit animation, audio, document, photo, or video messages. If a message is a part of a message album, then it can be edited only to a photo or a video. Otherwise, message type can be changed arbitrarily. When inline message is edited, new file can't be uploaded. Use previously uploaded file via its file_id or specify a URL.
member.param: BotClient
Parameters.
member.exception: Thrown when a request to Telegram Bot API got an error response.
Thrown when a required parameter is null.
member.returns: or . On success, if the edited message was sent by the bot, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.
